alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Cumberland; Nottoway; Prince Edward (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 6:24PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Cumberland, Prince Edward, northwestern Nottoway and northwestern Amelia Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 624 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Dillwyn to near Sheppards to Madisonville. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cumberland, Farmville, Cartersville, Hampden Sydney, Hampden Sydney College, Longwood University, Burkeville, Columbia, Guinea Mills, Darlington Heights, Sunnyside, Lakeside Village, Rice, Green Bay, Prospect, Duncan, Raines Tavern, Tuggle, Prince Edward Station and Angola. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
